section: 11. The Managers will jointly decide major issues concerning the Venture. Where Managers are unable to reach agreement in deciding major issues, approval by a majority vote of the Managers will be required.
explanation: This section outlines that managers must jointly decide on major issues. However, it then states that if they cannot agree, a majority vote of the *Managers* will be required. This creates an in-text contradiction because the definition of 'Managers' is that Aldo Piscitello and Jody Stewart have been appointed by the *Members*. This means that the Members appointed the Managers, but this section states that the majority of the Managers will be required, meaning Aldo Piscitello and Jody Stewart have to agree when the decision is intended to be by the Members, meaning BorrowMoney.com, inc and JVLS, LLC.

section: 15. Each of the Members has contributed to the capital of the Venture, in cash or property in agreed upon value, as follows (the "Capital Contribution"): Member Contribution Description Agreed Value BorrowMoney.com, inc 1, 500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty* $3,500,000.00 USD JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD From Monthly Government , City And State, And Or Private Awarded Contracts. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions. $3,500,000.00 USD
explanation: This section describes each members capital contribution. BorrowMoney.com, inc contributed 1,500 square feet of leased office space and that has an agreed value of $3,500,000.00. JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go contributed $60,000.00 USD from contracts and 10% of any gross revenue. This is also valued at $3,500,000.00. There is no evidence to suggest that JVLS, LLC would have the same amount in capital contribution as the leased office space from BorrowMoney.com, inc. In addition, 10% is ambiguous as it is not clearly stated what contract JVLS, LLC should be receiving the 10% of, so the calculation on whether it would be equal to the $3,500,000.00 cannot be determined, creating an in-text contradiction.

section: 35. Distribution of any amount owing to a dissociated Member will be made according to the percentage of ownership as described in the Valuation of Interest or as otherwise may be agreed in writing.
explanation: This section states how distribution of any amount owing to a dissociated Member will be distributed. It states that it would be according to the percentage of ownership as described in the 'Valuation of Interest' but no percentage of ownership has been defined. This makes the contract structurally flawed and does not make sense.
